# showWindow(_:)

**Instance Method**

Displays the window associated with the receiver.

## Declaration

```swift
@IBAction @MainActor func showWindow(_ sender: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: The control sending the message; can be `nil`.

## Discussion

If the window is an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPanel] object and has its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPanel/becomesKeyOnlyIfNeeded] flag set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the window is displayed in front of all other windows but is not made key; otherwise it is displayed in front and is made key. This method is useful for menu actions.

## Related Documentation

- **orderFront(_:)**: Moves the window to the front of its level in the screen list, without changing either the key window or the main window.
- **makeKeyAndOrderFront(_:)**: Moves the window to the front of the screen list, within its level, and makes it the key window; that is, it shows the window.

## Loading and Displaying the Window

- **loadWindow()**: Loads the receiver’s window from the nib file.
- **isWindowLoaded**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the nib file containing the receiver’s window has been loaded.
- **window**: The window owned by the receiver.
- **windowDidLoad()**: Sent after the window owned by the receiver has been loaded.
- **windowWillLoad()**: Sent before the window owned by the receiver is loaded.
